result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leroy D Newman Jr.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Leroy D Newman Jr. not in court, in custody. Attorney Allison Marie Ritter appeared by video for Leroy D Newman Jr.  Attorney Abby Rockendorf  appeared in court on behalf of Annie Louk for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Attorney Ritter was recently appointed and is requesting a status conference date. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. NOTICE OF RETAINER

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/25/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Nieshia O Rowell in court.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge  Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 12 pages) commencing 08-10-2022 by Irene Koenigs.

Defendant Leroy D Newman in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent; both appear by video.  Defendant Leroy D Newman in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of Racine County case 19CF1190. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer E. Rummel. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Leroy D Newman in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Leroy D Newman in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Leroy D Newman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Leroy D Newman Jr.
Current: 5256 N 48th St, Milwaukee, WI 53218   (Effective: 08-02-2022)
Prior: 8854 West Fairmount Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53218
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
